private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest among these, E is largest among these).
I can perform only primitive moves of the form: move the top disk of a peg to another peg.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is reached: left peg (top->bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) B; right peg (top->bottom) A, D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that only involve disks A-E and obey Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: F, G, H, I, J (F is smallest among these, J is largest among these).
I can perform only primitive moves of the form: move the top disk of a peg to another peg.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is reached: left peg (top->bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) B; right peg (top->bottom) A, D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that only involve disks F-J and obey Tower of Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the move sequences from agent_1 and agent_2 into a single valid cooperative plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that encodes the multi-agent actions while keeping the agents' moves distinct.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. A is the smallest disk, J is the largest disk.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Goal configuration: left peg from top to bottom: C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg: B (top to bottom single); right peg from top to bottom: A, D.
Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; only the top disk of any peg may be moved; a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E. Agent_2 may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planning task. You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only those disks and that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Consider the public information about the puzzle and your private information about which disks you may move and the global goal. Produce a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves involving only A-E that helps achieve the global goal, formatted one move per line as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only move top disks and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Do not make assumptions beyond the provided public and private information.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi planning task. You may only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only those disks and that obey the Tower of Hanoi rules. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Consider the public information about the puzzle and your private information about which disks you may move and the global goal. Produce a step-by-step ordered list of primitive moves involving only F-J that helps achieve the global goal, formatted one move per line as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only move top disks and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Do not make assumptions beyond the provided public and private information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that integrates multiple agents' move sequences into a single, correct cooperative plan and produces a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing or otherwise separating agent_1 and agent_2 actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL must model three pegs, the ten disks A-J, the Tower of Hanoi constraints, and two agents with action schemas limited to the disks they are allowed to move. Target the FastDownward solver (use STRIPS/ADL constructs compatible with FastDownward).
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the ordered primitive move lists produced by both agents. Integrate these lists into a single valid cooperative plan that respects agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules and verify correctness against the public initial and goal configurations. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the multi-agent moves and the goal, suitable for input to the FastDownward planner. Keep actions for agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the domain so the planner can attribute moves to the correct agent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Here is the information from agent_1: {moves_agent_1} Here is the information from agent_2: {moves_agent_2}
